intro: Anemia salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran anemia plant, is a rare species native to Central America. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and delicate, pale green flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical forests. Its botanical classification places it within the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
